description:
In the remote and mysterious Moomin Valley live the Moomin trolls, gentle and peaceful creatures. Young Moomin and his family experience many strange adventures, both magical and mundane. Based on the children's stories by Tove Jansson.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Classic Literature
tags.description: Discusses or adapts a work of classic world literature.

tags.name: Kids
tags.description: Target demographic is young children.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Pirates
tags.description: Prominently features sea-faring adventurers branded as criminals by the law.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Mermaid
tags.description: A mythological creature with the body of a human and the tail of a fish.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Drawing
tags.description: Centers around the art of drawing, including manga and doujinshi.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Writing
tags.description: Centers around the profession of writing books or novels.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Aviation
tags.description: Regarding the flying or operation of aircraft.

tags.name: Fishing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of fishing.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Snowscape
tags.description: Prominently or partially set in a snowy environment.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/白鳥澄夫) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sumio_Shiratori)

Best known for his work in the Japanese-Finnish anime series, [Moomin](https://anilist.co/anime/2150/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小島正幸) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masayuki_Kojima)

Originating from Kaname Production, currently affiliated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/).

Known for directing shows such as [Monster](https://anilist.co/anime/19/), [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/) and [Hanada Shounen-shi](https://anilist.co/anime/2004/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/斎藤博_(アニメ監督%29)

Hiroshi Saitou is a director, screenwriter and storyboard artist. Often goes by one of his many pen-names.

[Wiki (fin)](https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benny_T%C3%B6rnroos)

Benny Törnroos is a Finnish-Swedish singer and actor.

[Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lars_Jansson_(cartoonist%29) | [Wiki (fin)](https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lars_Jansson)

Lars Jansson was a Finnish author and cartoonist.

A native of Helsinki, Jansson was the son of a sculptor, Viktor Jansson, and a Swedish-born illustrator, Signe Hammarsten-Jansson. His siblings included an older sister, writer Tove Jansson, and an older brother, photographer Per Olov Jansson. In 1958, he began working with his sister on the writing of the Moomin comic strip, which he drew from 1961 to 1974. Between 1990 and 1992, Jansson worked with Dennis Livson to develop the concept of the Moomin animated series in Japan. His daughter, Sophia, worked together with him in 1993 to help manage the production of a new series of Moomin strips which Sophia now manages solely.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (fin)](https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dennis_Livson)

Dennis Livson was a Finnish producer, amusement park entrepreneur, and founder of [Telescreen BV](https://anilist.co/studio/358/).

[Wiki (fin)](https://fi.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dennis_Livson)

Dennis Livson was a Finnish producer, amusement park entrepreneur, and founder of [Telescreen BV](https://anilist.co/studio/358/).

An Italian singer and actress. She sings for television and animation series, and has recorded numerous albums, selling nearly 7 million copies. In Italy, she is also known for singing the Italian version of the theme song of many anime, including One Piece, Doraemon, Attacker YOU! ("Mila e Shiro" in Italian), Sailor Moon and Captain Tsubasa ("Holly e Benji" in Italian).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小島正幸) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masayuki_Kojima)

Originating from Kaname Production, currently affiliated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/).

Known for directing shows such as [Monster](https://anilist.co/anime/19/), [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/) and [Hanada Shounen-shi](https://anilist.co/anime/2004/).
He is a scriptwriter and novelist.

__Birth place:__ Arakawa, Tokyo, Japan

A writer for many anime, such as: Moomin, Kumo no yôni, kaze no yôni, Alfred J. Kwak and Ai no wakakusa monogatari. He also worked on many movies and TV shows.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/宮崎晃)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/斎藤博_(アニメ監督%29)

Hiroshi Saitou is a director, screenwriter and storyboard artist. Often goes by one of his many pen-names.
Originating from Takahashi Production, a photography studio.
